description: LLM Passthrough Service - Unified Observability Dashboard. Provides operational and business view of the LLM passthrough service with modern design (Gateway style). Includes Success Rates, Usage Patterns, Latency Behavior, Tenant-Level Metrics, Business Usage, and Infrastructure Health sections. NOTE: Token count metrics and tenant-level metrics (product_id) require proper instrumentation. Use Arize for token/cost tracking. Includes Grafana Alert Rules for High Error Rate (Critical) and Response Time Degradation (Warning).

links.title: Arize Dashboard (Token & Cost Metrics)
links.tooltip: View token counts, LLM call details, and cost metrics in Arize

panels.description: Total number of requests processed by the LLM service during the selected time range.
panels.title: üî® Total Requests (Time Range)

panels.description: Total successful requests (2xx/3xx) during the selected time range.
panels.title: ‚úÖ Successful Requests (Time Range)

panels.description: Total failed requests (4xx/5xx) during the selected time range.
panels.title: ‚ùå Failed Requests (Time Range)

panels.description: Current requests per second being handled by the LLM service.
panels.title: ‚ö° Current Request Rate

panels.description: Number of calls per endpoint (URI) during the selected time range. Shows request distribution across different API endpoints.
panels.title: üìä Endpoint Calls (Time Range)

panels.description: Number of failed calls (4xx/5xx) per endpoint (URI) during the selected time range.

targets.expr: round(sum by (endpoint) (increase(http_request_count_total{datacenter=~"$dc", namespace=~"$namespace", name="service-large-language-model", http_status=~"[45]..", endpoint=~".*/api/v1/.*"}[$__range]))) > 0

panels.title: ‚ùå Failed Endpoint Calls (Time Range)

panels.description: Current percentage of successful HTTP responses (2xx status codes) over a 5-minute rolling window. Target: ‚â•99% for production SLO.
panels.title: HTTP Success Rate (Current)

panels.description: Server-side error rate (5xx status codes). Alert threshold: >15% for 15 minutes triggers critical alert.
panels.title: 5xx Error Rate (Current) ‚ö†Ô∏è

panels.description: Client-side error rate (4xx status codes). Includes 400 (bad request), 401/403 (auth), 404 (not found), 422 (validation).
panels.title: 4xx Error Rate (Current)

panels.description: Combined 4xx and 5xx error rate. Critical alert fires when >15% for 15 minutes.
panels.title: Combined Error Rate (Current) üö®

panels.description: Trend of success and error rates over time. Red threshold line at 15% error rate (critical alert threshold).
panels.title: Success & Error Rate Trend

panels.description: Current requests per second being handled by the LLM service.
panels.title: ‚ö° Current RPS

panels.description: Total number of requests processed during the selected time range.
panels.title: üìä Total Requests

panels.description: Current HTTP success rate (2xx responses)
panels.title: ‚úÖ Success Rate

panels.description: Total 4xx/5xx errors in selected time range
panels.title: ‚ùå Total Errors

panels.description: Request distribution across endpoints in selected time range
panels.title: üìä Endpoint Distribution

panels.description: Request rate over time showing traffic patterns and usage trends.
panels.title: Request Rate Over Time

panels.description: Request rate broken down by endpoint, showing which LLM operations are most used.
panels.title: üìç Requests by Endpoint

panels.description: Request rate broken down by HTTP status code.
panels.title: üì∂ Requests by Status

panels.description: Average response time for LLM inference requests. LLM requests typically have higher latency (2-30s average) than traditional APIs.
panels.title: Average Latency

panels.description: P95 latency for LLM requests. Alert threshold: >10s for 15 minutes per technical requirements.
panels.title: P95 Latency

panels.description: P99 latency for LLM requests. Represents the worst-case response times experienced by 1% of users.
panels.title: P99 Latency

panels.description: P50 (median) latency for LLM requests. Represents typical request response time.
panels.title: P50 Latency

panels.description: Latency percentiles (P50, P90, P95, P99) over time. Use this to identify latency degradation patterns.
panels.title: Latency Percentiles Over Time

panels.description: P95 latency broken down by substream_id. Use this to identify which callers/tenants are experiencing high latency. Note: endpoint label is not available on latency metrics.
panels.title: P95 Latency by Substream ID

panels.description: Average latency broken down by substream_id. Shows which callers/tenants have higher average response times. Note: endpoint label is not available on latency metrics.

targets.expr:
sum by (substream_id) (rate(request_incoming_duration_seconds_sum{datacenter=~"$dc", namespace=~"$namespace", name="service-large-language-model"}[$__rate_interval]))
/
sum by (substream_id) (rate(request_incoming_duration_seconds_count{datacenter=~"$dc", namespace=~"$namespace", name="service-large-language-model"}[$__rate_interval]))

panels.title: Average Latency by Substream ID

options.content:
‚ö†Ô∏è Instrumentation Status

Tenant-level metrics require `product_id` label which is NOT currently instrumented on the LLM service metrics. Panels below show aggregated values (labeled 'Value') until the application team adds `product_id` label to:
- http_request_count_total
- request_incoming_duration_seconds_bucket

Alternative: The `substream_id` label IS available and could be used for tenant breakdown if it maps to tenant identification.

panels.description: 5xx error rate by tenant. Requires product_id label instrumentation.

targets.expr:
(
  sum by (product_id) (rate(http_request_count_total{datacenter=~"$dc", namespace=~"$namespace", name="service-large-language-model", http_status=~"5..", product_id=~"$product_id"}[$__rate_interval]))
  /
  sum by (product_id) (rate(http_request_count_total{datacenter=~"$dc", namespace=~"$namespace", name="service-large-language-model", product_id=~"$product_id"}[$__rate_interval]))
) * 100

panels.title: 5xx Error Rate by Tenant (product_id)

panels.description: 4xx error rate by tenant. Requires product_id label instrumentation.

targets.expr:
(
  sum by (product_id) (rate(http_request_count_total{datacenter=~"$dc", namespace=~"$namespace", name="service-large-language-model", http_status=~"4..", product_id=~"$product_id"}[$__rate_interval]))
  /
  sum by (product_id) (rate(http_request_count_total{datacenter=~"$dc", namespace=~"$namespace", name="service-large-language-model", product_id=~"$product_id"}[$__rate_interval]))
) * 100

panels.title: 4xx Error Rate by Tenant (product_id)

panels.description: P95 latency by tenant. Requires product_id label instrumentation.

targets.expr: histogram_quantile(0.95, sum by (le, product_id) (rate(request_incoming_duration_seconds_bucket{datacenter=~"$dc", namespace=~"$namespace", name="service-large-language-model", product_id=~"$product_id"}[$__rate_interval])))

panels.title: P95 Latency by Tenant (product_id)

panels.description: Request rate by tenant. Requires product_id label instrumentation.
panels.title: Request Rate by Tenant (product_id)

panels.description: Total number of LLM API calls in the selected time range. Includes both successful and failed requests across all endpoints.
panels.title: Total LLM API Calls (Time Range)

panels.description: Total token count for LLM API requests in the selected time range. IMPORTANT: This metric (llm_token_count_total) is NOT currently instrumented in Prometheus. Shows 0 until the metric is available. For accurate token counts and cost tracking, please use Arize dashboards.
panels.title: Total Token Count (Time Range)

panels.description: Average tokens per LLM API call. Indicates the typical complexity/length of requests.
panels.title: Average Tokens per Call

panels.description: LLM API call volume by tenant over time.
panels.title: LLM Calls by Tenant Over Time

panels.description: LLM API call volume broken down by endpoint. Tracks usage of /api/v1/chat/completions, /api/v1/text/completions, etc.
panels.title: LLM Calls by Endpoint Over Time

panels.description: LLM service deployment replica status showing available and unavailable pods.
panels.title: LLM Service Deployment Status

panels.description: CPU usage per LLM service pod in millicores.
panels.title: LLM Service CPU Usage

panels.description: Memory usage per LLM service pod (working set bytes).
panels.title: LLM Service Memory Usage

panels.description: CRITICAL ALERT: 5xx error rate > 15% for 15 minutes
panels.title: üö® High Error Rate Alert (CRITICAL)

panels.description: WARNING ALERT: P95 latency > 10 seconds for 15 minutes
panels.title: ‚ö†Ô∏è Response Time Alert (WARNING)

options.content:
### Alert Rules Configuration

| Alert | Condition | Duration | Severity |
|-------|-----------|----------|----------|
| **High Error Rate** | 5xx rate > 15% | 15 min | üî¥ Critical |
| **Response Time** | P95 > 10 sec | 15 min | üü† Warning |

**Deployment:** Use `llm-alert-rules.yaml` provisioning file
**Integration:** Configure PagerDuty/Slack in Grafana ‚Üí Alerting ‚Üí Contact Points
**Arize:** Token/cost alerts should be configured in Arize platform

list.description: Tenant / Product ID - NOTE: This label is NOT currently instrumented on metrics.
list.label: Product ID
list.name: product_id

title: LLM Passthrough Service - Unified Observability
